00044 class SIM_API cExpression
00045 {
00046   public:
00047     virtual ~cExpression() {}
00048     virtual std::string getAsText() = 0;
00049     virtual bool parseText(const char *text) = 0;
00050     virtual cExpression *dup() = 0;
00051 };

00078 class SIM_API cDoubleExpression : public cExpression
00079 {
00080   public:
00081     virtual std::string getAsText();
00082     virtual bool parseText(const char *text);
00083     virtual double evaluate() = 0;
00084 };

00116 class SIM_API cPar : public cObject
00117 {
00118   public:
00123     struct ExprElem
00124     {
00125         // Type chars:
00126         //   D  double constant
00127         //   P  pointer to "external" cPar (owned by someone else)
00128         //   R  "reference": the cPar will be dup()'ped and the copy kept
00129         //   0/1/2/3  function with 0/1/2/3 arguments
00130         //   @  math operator (+-*%/^=!<{>}?); see cPar::evaluate()
00131         //
00132         char type;    // D/P/R/0/1/2/3/@ (see above)
00133         union {
00134             double d;           // D
00135             cPar *p;            // P/R
00136             MathFuncNoArg f0;   // 0
00137             MathFunc1Arg  f1;   // 1
00138             MathFunc2Args f2;   // 2
00139             MathFunc3Args f3;   // 3
00140             MathFunc4Args f4;   // 4
00141             char op;            // @, op = +-*/%^=!<{>}?
00142         };
00143 
00148         void operator=(int _i)            {type='D'; d=_i;  }
00149 
00150 
00155         void operator=(short _i)            {type='D'; d=_i;  }
00156 
00161         void operator=(long _l)           {type='D'; d=_l;  }
00162 
00167         void operator=(double _d)         {type='D'; d=_d;  }
00168 
00176         void operator=(cPar *_p)          {type='P'; p=_p;  }
00177 
00184         void operator=(cPar& _r);         //{type='R'; p=(cPar *)_r.dup();} See after cPar!
00185 
00195         void operator=(MathFuncNoArg _f)  {type='0'; f0=_f;}
00196 
00208         void operator=(MathFunc1Arg  _f)  {type='1'; f1=_f;}
00209 
00222         void operator=(MathFunc2Args _f)  {type='2'; f2=_f;}
00223 
00236         void operator=(MathFunc3Args _f)  {type='3'; f3=_f;}
00237 
00250         void operator=(MathFunc4Args _f)  {type='4'; f4=_f;}
00251 
00265         void operator=(char _op)          {type='@'; op=_op;}
00266     };
00267 
00268   protected:
00269     static char *possibletypes;
00270   private:
00271     char typechar;     // S/B/L/D/F/T/X/C/P/O/I
00272     bool inputflag;
00273     bool changedflag;
00274     bool tkownership;
00275     opp_string promptstr; // prompt text used when the value is being input
00276 
00277     union {    // Take care of 'operator=()' when changing this!!!
00278        struct { bool sht; char *str;            } ls;   // S:long string
00279        struct { bool sht; char str[SHORTSTR+1]; } ss;   // S:short str
00280        struct { long val;                       } lng;  // L:long,B:bool
00281        struct { double val;                     } dbl;  // D:double
00282        struct { MathFunc f; int argc;
00283                 double p1,p2,p3,p4;             } func; // F:math function
00284        struct { cStatistic *res;                } dtr;  // T:distribution
00285        struct { cDoubleExpression *expr;        } cexpr;// C:compiled expression
00286        struct { ExprElem *xelem; int n;         } expr; // X:expression
00287        struct { cPar *par;                      } ind;  // I:indirection
00288        struct { void *ptr;
00289                 VoidDelFunc delfunc;
00290                 VoidDupFunc dupfunc;
00291                 size_t itemsize;                } ptr;  // P:void* pointer
00292        struct { cObject *obj;                   } obj;  // O:object pointer
00293        struct { cXMLElement *node;              } xmlp; // M:XML element pointer
00294     };
00295 
00296   private:
00297     // helper func: destruct old value
00298     void deleteold();
00299 
00300     // helper func: evaluates expression (X)
00301     double evaluate();
00302 
00303     // helper func: rand.num with given distr.(T)
00304     double fromstat();
00305 
00306     // setFromText() helper func.
00307     bool setfunction(char *w);
00308 
00309   protected:
00312 
00318     virtual void beforeChange();
00319 
00325     virtual void afterChange();
00327 
00328   public:
00331 
00335     cPar(const cPar& other);
00336 
00341     explicit cPar(const char *name=NULL);
00342 
00347     explicit cPar(const char *name, cPar& other);
00348 
00352     virtual ~cPar();
00353

00367 
00370 
00375     virtual cPolymorphic *dup() const   {return new cPar(*this);}
00376

00382 
00386     virtual std::string detailedInfo() const;
00387 
00392     virtual void writeContents(std::ostream& os);
00393 
00398     virtual void forEachChild(cVisitor *v);

00898 // this function cannot be defined within ExprElem because of declaration order
00899 inline void cPar::ExprElem::operator=(cPar& _r)  {type='R'; p=(cPar *)_r.dup();}

00911 class SIM_API cModulePar : public cPar
00912 {
00913     friend class cModule;
00914   private:
00915     cModule *omodp;              // owner module
00916 
00917   private:
00918     // helper function
00919     void _construct();
00920 
00921   public:
00924 
00928     cModulePar(const cPar& other);
00929 
00933     explicit cModulePar(const char *name=NULL);
00934 
00938     explicit cModulePar(const char *name, cPar& other);
00939 
00943     virtual ~cModulePar();
00944 
00949     cModulePar& operator=(const cModulePar& otherpar);
00951 
00954 
00959     virtual cPolymorphic *dup() const  {return new cPar(*this);}
00960 
00964     virtual std::string fullPath() const;
00965 
00970     virtual const char *fullPath(char *buffer, int bufsize) const;
00972 
00978     virtual void afterChange();
00980 
00983 
00987     void setOwnerModule(cModule *om)   {omodp=om;}
00988 
00992     cModule *ownerModule() const        {return omodp;}
00994 };

00996 inline std::ostream& operator<< (std::ostream& os, const cPar& o) {
00997     return os << o.getAsText();
00998 }

01000 inline std::ostream& operator<< (std::ostream& os, cPar& o) {
01001     return os << o.getAsText();

01005 //=== operators dealing with cPars
01006 //
01007 // These operators were removed -- see ChangeLog, Jan 17 2000 entry.
01008 //
01009 
01010 //#ifndef NO_CPAR_OPERATIONS
01011 //#ifdef  LONG_CPAR_OPERATIONS
01012 // inline int operator<(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (long)p<(long)q;}
01013 // inline int operator<(long d, cPar& p)   {return d<(long)p;}
01014 // inline int operator<(cPar& p, long d)   {return (long)p<d;}
01015 // inline int operator>(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (long)p>(long)q;}
01016 // inline int operator>(long d, cPar& p)   {return d>(long)p;}
01017 // inline int operator>(cPar& p, long d)   {return (long)p>d;}
01018 //
01019 // inline int operator<=(cPar& p, cPar& q) {return (long)p<=(long)q;}
01020 // inline int operator<=(long d, cPar& p)  {return d<=(long)p;}
01021 // inline int operator<=(cPar& p, long d)  {return (long)p<=d;}
01022 // inline int operator>=(cPar& p, cPar& q) {return (long)p>=(long)q;}
01023 // inline int operator>=(long d, cPar& p)  {return d>=(long)p;}
01024 // inline int operator>=(cPar& p, long d)  {return (long)p>=d;}
01025 //
01026 // inline long operator+(cPar& p, cPar& q) {return (long)p+(long)q;}
01027 // inline long operator+(long d, cPar& p)  {return d+(long)p;}
01028 // inline long operator+(cPar& p, long d)  {return (long)p+d;}
01029 // inline long operator-(cPar& p, cPar& q) {return (long)p-(long)q;}
01030 // inline long operator-(long d, cPar& p)  {return d-(long)p;}
01031 // inline long operator-(cPar& p, long d)  {return (long)p-d;}
01032 //
01033 // inline long operator*(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (long)p*(long)q;}
01034 // inline long operator*(long d, cPar& p)   {return d*(long)p;}
01035 // inline long operator*(cPar& p, long d)   {return (long)p*d;}
01036 // inline long operator/(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (long)p/(long)q;}
01037 // inline long operator/(long d, cPar& p)   {return d/(long)p;}
01038 // inline long operator/(cPar& p, long d)   {return (long)p/d;}
01039 //
01040 //#else
01041 //
01042 // inline int operator<(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p<(double)q;}
01043 // inline int operator<(double d, cPar& p) {return d<(double)p;}
01044 // inline int operator<(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p<d;}
01045 // inline int operator>(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p>(double)q;}
01046 // inline int operator>(double d, cPar& p) {return d>(double)p;}
01047 // inline int operator>(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p>d;}
01048 //
01049 // inline int operator<=(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p<=(double)q;}
01050 // inline int operator<=(double d, cPar& p) {return d<=(double)p;}
01051 // inline int operator<=(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p<=d;}
01052 // inline int operator>=(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p>=(double)q;}
01053 // inline int operator>=(double d, cPar& p) {return d>=(double)p;}
01054 // inline int operator>=(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p>=d;}
01055 //
01056 // inline double operator+(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p+(double)q;}
01057 // inline double operator+(double d, cPar& p) {return d+(double)p;}
01058 // inline double operator+(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p+d;}
01059 // inline double operator-(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p-(double)q;}
01060 // inline double operator-(double d, cPar& p) {return d-(double)p;}
01061 // inline double operator-(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p-d;}
01062 //
01063 // inline double operator*(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p*(double)q;}
01064 // inline double operator*(double d, cPar& p) {return d*(double)p;}
01065 // inline double operator*(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p*d;}
01066 // inline double operator/(cPar& p, cPar& q)  {return (double)p/(double)q;}
01067 // inline double operator/(double d, cPar& p) {return d/(double)p;}
01068 // inline double operator/(cPar& p, double d) {return (double)p/d;}
01069 //#endif
01070 //#endif
